intro: This page outlines the entry requirements for students who normally live in Afghanistan and wish to study at the University of St Andrews.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: Foundation Programme
qualifications.detail: Required if you hold a national High School leaving certificate.

qualifications.name: A-levels
qualifications.detail: AAB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: Master's degree
qualifications.detail: Must be from an accredited institution with a minimum grade of 85%, or a GPA of 3.5/4.0.

english_language: You must provide evidence of English proficiency. Pre-sessional courses (10-week or 4-week) are available.
visa_info: Overseas students typically need a visa. You must pass a SELT (Secure English Language Test) approved by UKVI.

fees.info: Tuition fees are set at the Overseas rate. Financial assistance information is available on the scholarships page.

intro: If you are a student living in China, there are specific entry requirements depending on which qualifications you are studying.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: Foundation Programme
qualifications.detail: Excellent preparation for undergraduate study if you hold a national school leaving certificate.

qualifications.name: US Curriculum
qualifications.detail: High School Transcript (Grades A to B+) PLUS one standardized test: AP (3 subjects at 4+), ACT (28+), or SAT (1320+).

qualifications.name: A-levels
qualifications.detail: AAB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: SQA Highers
qualifications.detail: AAAB to AAAAB

qualifications.name: Bachelor's degree
qualifications.detail: Must be from an accredited institution with a minimum grade of 78%.

english_language: We accept a wide range of language tests. Pre-sessional courses are available to help prepare you for academic study.
visa_info: Overseas students typically need a visa. You must take an approved SELT (Secure English Language Test) to obtain your visa.

fees.info: Tuition fees are set at the Overseas rate. Information on funding and scholarships is available.

intro: Entry requirements for students from England. A-levels and other UK qualifications are accepted.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: A-Levels
qualifications.detail: ABB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: BTEC National Diploma (Level 3)
qualifications.detail: Two Distinctions and one Distinction* (D, D, D*) where AAA is required.

qualifications.name: Cambridge Pre-U
qualifications.detail: D2 (for A*), D3 (for A), M1 (for B).

qualifications.name: Access to Higher Education Diploma
qualifications.detail: Minimum 45 credits at Level 3 at Distinction and Merit.

qualifications.name: T Levels
qualifications.detail: Not currently accepted for degree entry.

qualifications.name: Bachelor's Degree
qualifications.detail: Minimum of an upper second-class (2.1) honours degree from a UK university.

fees.info: Tuition fees apply. See undergraduate fees page for details.

intro: Entry requirements for students from Jamaica.

qualifications.name: CAPE
qualifications.detail: Grade I in at least three two-unit courses.

qualifications.name: Bachelor degree
qualifications.detail: Upper Second Class Honours from UWI or UTech.

qualifications.name: Master's degree
qualifications.detail: Considered for PhD entry.

english_language: PG candidates need an Upper Second Class Honours.

intro: Entry requirements for students from Northern Ireland.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: A-Levels
qualifications.detail: AAB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: SQA Highers
qualifications.detail: AAAB to AAAAB

qualifications.name: Open University
qualifications.detail: 60 Credits of Access Modules with high pass grade.

qualifications.name: Bachelor's Degree
qualifications.detail: Minimum of an upper second-class (2.1) honours degree from a UK university.

fees.info: Tuition fees apply. See undergraduate fees page for details.

intro: Entry requirements for students from Scotland.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: SQA Highers
qualifications.detail: AABB to AAAAB

qualifications.name: A-Levels
qualifications.detail: ABB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: SWAP Access
qualifications.detail: Profile of AAA.

qualifications.name: HNC/HND
qualifications.detail: HNC: 'A' Graded Unit (Year 1). HND: 'AA' Graded Units.

qualifications.name: Foundation Apprenticeships
qualifications.detail: Accepted as one additional Higher (except Medicine).

qualifications.name: BTEC National Diploma
qualifications.detail: Distinctions (D,D,D) to (D,D,D*) depending on A-level equivalent.

qualifications.name: Bachelor's Degree
qualifications.detail: Minimum of an upper second-class (2.1) honours degree from a UK university.

fees.info: Tuition fees apply. Check SAAS for funding eligibility.

intro: Entry requirements for students from the USA.

qualifications.name: High School Diploma
qualifications.detail: Grades of A or B in honours level courses.

qualifications.name: AP Tests
qualifications.detail: Three AP subjects with scores of 4+.

qualifications.name: Standardized Tests
qualifications.detail: Optional for 2025-2026. If submitted: ACT 28+ or SAT 1320+.

qualifications.name: Bachelor's Degree
qualifications.detail: BA or BS with a minimum GPA of 3.3, B+, or 76%. GMAT/GRE not required.

english_language: All students must provide evidence of English proficiency. See English language requirements page.
visa_info: Overseas students typically need a visa. UKVI requires a Secure English Language Test (SELT).

fees.info: Classed as Overseas. Federal Loans available.

intro: Entry requirements for students from Wales.

process_details.medicine_note: Applicants to Medicine should refer directly to the medicine course pages.
process_details.general_note: Undergraduate and postgraduate academic requirements are for general guidance.

qualifications.name: A-Levels
qualifications.detail: AAB to A*A*A

qualifications.name: Welsh Baccalaureate
qualifications.detail: Advanced Skills Baccalaureate Wales grade A can replace one A-level grade (except subject prerequisites).

qualifications.name: WJEC Level 3 Applied Diploma
qualifications.detail: Accepted in combination with two A-Levels.

qualifications.name: SQA Highers
qualifications.detail: AABB to AAAAB

qualifications.name: Bachelor's Degree
qualifications.detail: Minimum of an upper second-class (2.1) honours degree from a UK university.

fees.info: Tuition fees apply. See undergraduate fees page for details.
